title: Knott baronets
text: The Knott Baronetcy, of Close House in the Parish of Heddon-on-the-Wall in the County of Northumberland, was a title in the <a href="Baronetage%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">Baronetage of the United Kingdom</a>. It was created on 4 July 1917 for the shipping magnate and <a href="Conservative%20Party%20%28UK%29">Conservative</a> politician <a href="Sir%20James%20Knott%2C%201st%20Baronet">James Knott</a>. The title became extinct on the death of the second Baronet in 1949.
